belarus.notes: 16 – mopeds (AM), <125 cc/11 kW motorcycles (A1); 17 – <80 kW wheeled tractors and self-propelled machines (A) and all kinds of continuous tracked tractors, SPMs and bulldozers (C); 18 – all kinds of motorcycles (A), cars with light trailers and up to 8 passengers buses (B), trucks with light trailers (C), all kinds of wheeled tractors (B), SPMs (D), special vehicles (E) and <1m3 excavators (F); 21 – buses for more than 8 passengers(D), cars, trucks and buses with heavy trailers (BE, CE, DE), trams (F) and trolleybuses (I).

japan.notes: See also: Driving licence in Japan
japan.value: 16 (motorcycles under 400 cc) 18 (ordinary/semi-medium vehicle and motorcycles over 401 cc)

poland.notes: See also: Driving licence in Poland
poland.value: 18 16 for motorcycles up to 125 cc 14 for mopeds and quads

estonia.notes: Driving age for cars is 16 with supervision. Unrestricted licence available at 18.

sweden.notes: See also: Driving licence in Sweden Driving age for cars is 16 with supervision. Unrestricted licence available at 18.
sweden.value: 18 for cars 15/16 for mopeds and tractors

philippines.notes: See also: Driving license in the Philippines

switzerland.value: Driving age for cars is 17 with supervision. 14 for mopeds and tractors

australia.notes: See also: Driving licence in Australia The minimum age to obtain a car or motorcycle learner license which allows driving under supervision is 15 years and 9 months, in the ACT. All other states and territories require learner drivers to be 16 years of age or older. Driving unsupervised by progressing to a provisional license is possible after 12 months, with minimum supervised hours (including nighttime driving) required in the form of a logbook. The exception to this is the Northern Territory, where learner drivers can progress to a provisional license after 6 months, without the need for a driving test or logbook.

indonesia.notes: See also: Driving license in Indonesia

unitedkingdom.notes: See also: Driving licence in the United Kingdom
unitedkingdom.value: 17 (cars) 16 (mopeds and tractors)(cars if disabled and in receipt of PIP or DLA) 16 (Light Quadricycle)

newzealand.notes: See also: Driving licence in New Zealand The minimum age to obtain a car or motorcycle learner licence which allows driving under supervision is 16. The minimum possible age to obtain a full licence, without any supervision or conditions, is 17½ years if a driver completes an advanced driving course. Without an advanced driving course, the minimum age is 18, the same as a heavy vehicle licence.

austria.notes: (Start with 15,5 under L17 attendant driving training

spain.value: 15 for mopeds and quads 16 for motorcycles up to 125 cc 18 for general licence

southafrica.notes: The National Road Traffic act specifies that a driver needs to be 17 to legally obtain a license for all motor vehicles under 3500 kg. 17-year-olds may allow one to obtain a learners license, to drive while supervised by an already licensed driver who has had their license for more than a year. To obtain an actual drivers license, the age is 18 years old.

hungary.notes: Driving age for cars is 17 with supervision. Unrestricted license is available at 18.
hungary.value: 17 16 for motorcycles under 125ccm 14 for vehicles under 50ccm

greece.notes: Driving age for cars is 17 with supervision. Unrestricted license is available at 18.

luxembourg.notes: Driving age for low power motorcycles and tractors 16. Driving licence for cars available at 18.

cyprus.notes: See also: Driving licence in Cyprus

italy.notes: See also: Driving licence in Italy Driving 17 with supervision of a person under 60 years in possession of full B licence (or superior). Unrestricted licence available at 18.

finland.notes: See also: Driving licence in Finland
finland.value: 18 for cars (17 with exception permit) 15 (mopeds, micro cars, tractors)

singapore.notes: See also: Driving licence in Singapore

elsalvador.notes: Driving age for cars is 15 with supervision. Unrestricted licence available at 18.

norway.notes: See also: Driving licence in Norway
norway.value: 18 for cars 16 for mopeds and light motorcycles

northerncyprus.notes: See also: Driving licence in Northern Cyprus

southkorea.notes: See also: Driving license in South Korea
southkorea.value: 18 for regular passenger cars and motorbikes over 125 cc 16 for motorbikes under 125 cc 19 for commercial license

argentina.notes: 21 is the minimum age to drive a truck, bus or emergency vehicle. 16 is the minimum age to drive a moped (without passengers). Parental approval is necessary for any license issued to any individual aged under 18.

jamaica.value: 16-17 learners permit or with adult supervision, 18 fully licensed

thailand.notes: Other restrictions apply to large or specialised vehicles. See also: Driving licence in Thailand
thailand.value: 18 (cars and motorcycles); 15 (motorcycles with 110 cc or smaller engines)

france.notes: Driving age for cars is 15 with supervision. Unrestricted licence available at 18

slovakia.notes: Driving age for cars is 17 with supervision. Unrestricted licence available at 18.

belgium.notes: See also: Driving licence in Belgium

netherlands.notes: See also: Driving licence in the Netherlands Driving age for cars is 17 with supervision. Driving lessons available at 16½. Unrestricted licence available at 18.
netherlands.value: 17 for cars 16 for mopeds and tractors

taiwan.notes: See also: Driving license in Taiwan

canada.notes: See also: Driving licence in Canada
canada.value: 16 with graduated license program (GLP) in most provinces 14 with GLP in Alberta 15 with GLP in Yukon, NWT, and Nunavut

brazil.notes: Drivers have to be previously licensed in cat. 'B' for at least one year before applying for a professional license. 'C' category are usually for load trucks, 'D' for buses and trucks and 'E' for articulated vehicles.

germany.notes: See also: Driving licence in Germany Driving age for cars is 17 with supervision. Unrestricted licence available at 18. Licenses for mopeds < 25 km/h are available at 15, for scooters < 45 km/h and motorcycles under 126ccm at 16.

india.notes: See also: Driving licence in India Applications for a provisional driving license can be made from the age of 16. It has been canceled since 2 wheelers under 50cc are no longer in production. After turning 18 a person can get a license at the regional transport office of their district.

malaysia.notes: See also: Driving licence in Malaysia

unitedstates.notes: See also: Driver's license in the United States
unitedstates.value: 14–16 (for permit) 16–17 (for restricted license) 17–18 (for unrestricted license) varies between states

denmark.notes: The minimum age for driving a car without supervision is 18. The minimum driving age for heavy truck and heavy bus can go down to 18, if the license is obtained during military service * It is only possible to obtain a license for snowmobiles on Greenland.
denmark.value: 24 for heavy bus 21 for heavy truck 17 for cars 15 for mopeds, quads and snowmobiles*

latvia.notes: 16 for cars(B), 21 for motorcycles(A2), trailers(C1, BE, C1E), 16 for motorcycles(A1), 14 for mopeds(M) - if supervised by a person holding a B category licence for at least three years (also known as training driving)
latvia.value: 18 for cars(B), trailers(C1, BE, C1E),/>24 motorcycles (A), />21 motorcycles(A2) 16 for motorcycles(A1), resting boats 14 for mopeds(M) 10 for bicycle

slovenia.notes: Driving age for cars is 16 with supervision. Unrestricted licence available at 18.

iceland.notes: Driving age for cars is 16 with supervision. Unrestricted licence available at 17.

qatar.value: 18 for light motor vehicles  21 for heavy vehicles

israel.value: 16 years for motorcycles 16 years 6 months with driving teacher 16 years 9 months for cars with 3 months parental supervision all times and 3 more months at night

ireland.notes: 16 for work vehicles, tractors etc. and motorbikes <125cc
